database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.description: The data bucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

dce_rpc.caption: Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call (DCE/RPC)
dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments.

debug.caption: Debug Information
debug.description: Debug information about non-fatal issues with this OCSF event. Each issue is a line in this string array.

decision.caption: Authorization Decision/Outcome
decision.description: Decision/outcome of the authorization mechanism (e.g. Approved, Denied)

delay.caption: Root Delay
delay.description: The total round-trip delay to the reference clock in milliseconds.

deleted_time.caption: Deleted Time
deleted_time.description: The timestamp when the user was deleted. In Active Directory (AD), when a user is deleted they are moved to a temporary container and then removed after 30 days. So, this field can be populated even after a user is deleted for the next 30 days.

delivered_to.caption: Delivered To
delivered_to.description: The machine-readable Delivered-To email header field. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

delivered_to_list.caption: Delivered To
delivered_to_list.description: The machine-readable Delivered-To email header values. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

dependency_chain.caption: Dependency Chain
dependency_chain.description: Information about the chain of dependencies related to the issue as reported by an Application Security or Vulnerability Management tool. E.g., serverless-offline -> @serverless/utils -> memoizee -> es5-ext.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display
desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event

details.caption: Details
details.description: Details of an entity. See specific usage

detection_pattern.caption: Detection Pattern
detection_pattern.description: Specific pattern, algorithm, fingerprint, or model used for detection.

detection_pattern_type.caption: Detection Pattern
detection_pattern_type.description: The detection pattern type, normalized to the caption of the detection_pattern_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

detection_pattern_type_id.caption: Detection Pattern Type ID
detection_pattern_type_id.description: Specifies the type of detection pattern used to identify the associated threat indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The detection pattern type is not mapped. See the detection_pattern_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

detection_system.caption: Detection System
detection_system.description: The name of the type of data security tool or system that the finding, detection, or alert originated from. E.g., Endpoint, Secure Email Gateway, etc.

detection_system_id.caption: Detection System ID
detection_system_id.description: The type of data security tool or system that the finding, detection, or alert originated from.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the detection_system attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Endpoint
1.description: A dedicated agent or sensor installed on a device, either a dedicated data security tool or an Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Symantec DLP, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint (MDE).

2.caption: DLP Gateway
2.description: A Data Loss Prevention (DLP) gateway that is positioned in-line of an information store such as a network share, a database, or otherwise that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies.

3.caption: Mobile Device Management
3.description: A Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies on mobile devices (e.g., cellphones, tablets, End User Devices [EUDs]).

4.caption: Data Discovery & Classification
4.description: A tool that actively identifies and classifies sensitive data in digital media and information stores in accordance with a policy or automated functionality. E.g, Amazon Macie, Microsoft Purview.

5.caption: Secure Web Gateway
5.description: A Secure Web Gateway (SWG) is any tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies at a network-edge such as within a proxy or firewall service.

6.caption: Secure Email Gateway
6.description: A Secure Email Gateway (SEG) is any tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies within email systems. E.g., Microsoft Defender for Office, Google Workspaces.

7.caption: Digital Rights Management
7.description: A Digital Rights Management (DRM) or a dedicated Information Rights Management (IRM) are tools which can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies on digital media via policy or user access rights.

8.caption: Cloud Access Security Broker
8.description: A Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies in-line to cloud systems such as the public cloud or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) tool. E.g., Forcepoint CASB, SkyHigh Security.

9.caption: Database Activity Monitoring
9.description: A Database Activity Monitoring (DAM) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies as part of a dedicated database or warehouse monitoring solution.

10.caption: Application-Level DLP
10.description: A built in Data Loss Prevention (DLP) or other data security capability within a tool or platform such as an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) or Customer Relations Management (CRM) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies.

11.caption: Developer Security
11.description: Any Developer Security tool such as an Infrastructure-as-Code (IAC) security scanner, Secrets Detection, or Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies. E.g., TruffleHog, GitGuardian, Git-Secrets.

12.caption: Data Security Posture Management
12.description: A Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) tool is a continuous monitoring and data discovery solution that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies for local and cloud environments. E.g., Cyera, Sentra, IBM Polar Security.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of detection system or a multi-variate system made up of several other systems.

detection_uid.caption: Detection UID
detection_uid.description: The associated unique detection event identifier. For example: detection response events include the Detection ID of the original event.

developer_uid.caption: Developer UID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

devices.caption: Devices
devices.description: The object describes details related to the list of devices.

digest.caption: Message Digest
digest.description: The message digest attribute contains the fixed length message hash representation and the corresponding hashing algorithm information.

direction.caption: Direction
direction.description: The direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email, normalized to the caption of the direction_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

direction_id.caption: Direction ID
direction_id.description: The normalized identifier of the direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email.

1.caption: Inbound
1.description: Inbound network connection. The connection was originated from the Internet or outside network, destined for services on the inside network.

2.caption: Outbound
2.description: Outbound network connection. The connection was originated from inside the network, destined for services on the Internet or outside network.

3.caption: Lateral
3.description: Lateral network connection. The connection was originated from inside the network, destined for services on the inside network.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The direction is not mapped. See the direction attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

discovery_details.caption: Discovery Details
discovery_details.description: A collection of Discovery Details objects. See specific usage.

dispersion.caption: Root Dispersion
dispersion.description: The dispersion in the NTP protocol is the estimated time error or uncertainty relative to the reference clock in milliseconds.

display_name.caption: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name. See specific usage.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dkim.caption: DKIM Status
dkim.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_domain.caption: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dkim_signature.caption: DKIM Signature
dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.

dmarc.caption: DMARC Status
dmarc.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.caption: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.

dnssec_status_id.caption: DNSSEC Status ID
dnssec_status_id.description: Describes the normalized status of DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC) for a domain.

1.caption: Signed
1.description: The related domain enables the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.

2.caption: Unsigned
2.description: The related domain does not enable the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNSSEC status is not mapped. See the dnssec_status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The name of the domain. See specific usage.

domain_contact.caption: Domain Contact
domain_contact.description: The contact information related to a domain registration, e.g., registrant, administrator, abuse, billing, or technical contact.

drive_type.caption: Drive Type
drive_type.description: The drive type, normalized to the caption of the drive_type_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the source.

drive_type_id.caption: Drive Type ID
drive_type_id.description: Identifies the type of a disk drive, i.e. fixed, removable, etc.

1.caption: Removable
1.description: The drive has removable media; for example, a floppy drive, thumb drive, or flash card reader.

2.caption: Fixed
2.description: The drive has fixed media; for example, a hard disk drive or flash drive.

3.caption: Remote
3.description: The drive is a remote (network) drive.

4.caption: CD-ROM
4.description: The drive is a CD-ROM drive.

5.caption: RAM Disk
5.description: The drive is a RAM disk.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The drive type is not mapped. See the drive_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

driver.caption: Kernel Driver
driver.description: The driver that was loaded/unloaded into the kernel

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: This represents the duration of the activity in milliseconds. See specific usage.

duration_days.caption: Duration Days
duration_days.description: Represents the duration of the activity in days. See specific usage.

duration_hours.caption: Duration Hours
duration_hours.description: Represents the duration of the activity in hours. See specific usage.

duration_mins.caption: Duration Minutes
duration_mins.description: Represents the duration of the activity in minutes. See specific usage.

duration_months.caption: Duration Months
duration_months.description: Represents the duration of the activity in months. See specific usage.

duration_secs.caption: Duration Seconds
duration_secs.description: Represents the duration of the activity in seconds. See specific usage.

duration_weeks.caption: Duration Weeks
duration_weeks.description: Represents the duration of the activity in weeks. See specific usage.

duration_years.caption: Duration Years
duration_years.description: Represents the duration of the activity in years. See specific usage.

edges.caption: Edges
edges.description: The list of edge objects that are part of the graph.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

eid.caption: EID
eid.description: An Embedded Identity Document, is a unique serial number that identifies an eSIM-enabled device.

email_addrs.caption: Email Addresses
email_addrs.description: A list of additional email addresses for the user.

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.description: The SPF, DKIM and DMARC attributes of an email.

email_uid.caption: Email UID
email_uid.description: The unique identifier of the email, used to correlate related email alert and activity events.

employee_uid.caption: Employee ID
employee_uid.description: The employee identifier assigned to the user by the organization.

encryption_details.caption: Encryption Details
encryption_details.description: The encryption details of a file or other content. See specific usage.

end_column.caption: End Column
end_column.description: The end column number. See specific usage.

end_line.caption: End Line
end_line.description: The line number of the last line of code block identified as vulnerable.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period. See specific usage.

endpoint_connections.caption: Endpoint Connections
endpoint_connections.description: Contains information about network connection attempts. See specific usage.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

entity.caption: Entity
entity.description: The managed entity that is being acted upon.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

event_code.caption: Event Code
event_code.description: The Event ID, Code, or Name that the product uses to primarily identify the event.

event_uid.caption: Event UID
event_uid.description: The unique identifier of an event. See specific usage.

evidence.caption: Evidence
evidence.description: The data the finding exposes to the analyst.

evidences.caption: Evidence Artifacts
evidences.description: A collection of evidence artifacts associated to the activity/activities that triggered a finding. See specific usage.

exit_code.caption: Exit Code
exit_code.description: The exit code reported by a process when it terminates. The convention is that zero indicates success and any non-zero exit code indicates that some error occurred.

expiration_reason.caption: Expiration Reason
expiration_reason.description: The expiration reason. See specific usage.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time. See specific usage.

exploit_last_seen_time.caption: Exploit Last Seen Time
exploit_last_seen_time.description: The time when the exploit was most recently observed.

exploit_ref_url.caption: Exploit URL
exploit_ref_url.description: The URL of the exploit code or Proof-of-Concept (PoC).

exploit_requirement.caption: Exploit Requirement
exploit_requirement.description: The requirement description related to any constraints around exploit execution.

exploit_type.caption: Exploit Type
exploit_type.description: The categorization or type of Exploit. E.g., Network or Physical.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.description: The schema extension used to create the event.

extensions.caption: Schema Extensions
extensions.description: The schema extensions used to create the event.

external_uid.caption: External ID
external_uid.description: A unique identifier assigned by an external system for cross-referencing.

factor_type.caption: Factor Type
factor_type.description: The type of authentication factor used in an authentication attempt.

factor_type_id.caption: Factor Type ID
factor_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the authentication factor.

1.caption: SMS
1.description: User receives and inputs a code sent to their mobile device via SMS text message.

2.caption: Security Question
2.description: The user responds to a security question as part of a question-based authentication factor

3.caption: Phone Call
3.description: System calls the user's registered phone number and requires the user to answer and provide a response.

4.caption: Biometric
4.description: Devices that verify identity-based on user's physical identifiers, such as fingerprint scanners or retina scanners.

5.caption: Push Notification
5.description: Push notification is sent to user's registered device and requires the user to acknowledge.

6.caption: Hardware Token
6.description: Physical device that generates a code to be used for authentication.

7.caption: OTP
7.description: Application generates a one-time password (OTP) for use in authentication.

8.caption: Email
8.description: A code or link is sent to a user's registered email address.

9.caption: U2F
9.description: Typically involves a hardware token, which the user physically interacts with to authenticate.

10.caption: WebAuthn
10.description: Web-based API that enables users to register devices as authentication factors.

11.caption: Password
11.description: The user enters a password that they have previously established.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

file_diff.caption: File Diff
file_diff.description: File content differences used for change detection. For example, a common use case is to identify itemized changes within INI or configuration/property setting values.

file_result.caption: File Result
file_result.description: The result of the file change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

files.caption: Files
files.description: The files that are part of the event or object.

finding.caption: Finding
finding.description: The Finding object provides details about a finding/detection generated by a security tool.

finding_info.caption: Finding Information
finding_info.description: Describes the supporting information about a generated finding.

finding_info_list.caption: Finding Information List
finding_info_list.description: A list of finding_info objects associated to an incident.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The digital fingerprint associated with an object.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: An array of digital fingerprint objects.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The initial detection time of the activity or object. See specific usage

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

fix_coverage.caption: Fix Coverage
fix_coverage.description: The fix coverage, normalized to the caption of the fix_coverage_id value. See specific usage.

fix_coverage_id.caption: Fix Coverage ID
fix_coverage_id.description: The normalized identifier for fix coverage. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The fix coverage is not mapped. See the fix_coverage attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

fixed_in_version.caption: Fixed In Version
fixed_in_version.description: The software package version in which a reported vulnerability was patched/fixed.

flag_history.caption: Connection Flag History
flag_history.description: The Connection Flag History summarizes events in a network connection. For example flags ShAD representing SYN, SYN/ACK, ACK and Data exchange.

flag_ids.caption: Communication Flag IDs
flag_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the communication flag IDs. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The flag is not mapped. See the flags attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

kerberos_flags.caption: Kerberos Flags
kerberos_flags.description: A bitmask, either in hexadecimal or decimal form, which encodes various attributes or permissions associated with a Kerberos ticket. These flags delineate specific characteristics of the ticket, such as its renewability or forwardability.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. See specific usage.

folder.caption: Folder
folder.description: The folder that pertains to the event.

from.caption: From
from.description: The machine-readable email header From values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

from_mailbox.caption: From Mailbox
from_mailbox.description: The human-readable email header From Mailbox value. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

full_name.caption: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name. See specific usage.

function_keys.caption: Function Keys
function_keys.description: The number of function keys on client keyboard.

function_name.caption: Function Name
function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.

geodetic_altitude.caption: Geodetic Altitude
geodetic_altitude.description: The aircraft distance above or below the ellipsoid as measured along a line that passes through the aircraft and is normal to the surface of the WGS-84 ellipsoid. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_vertical_accuracy.caption: Geodetic Vertical Accuracy
geodetic_vertical_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on geodetic altitude. This is based on ADS-B Geodetic Vertical Accuracy (GVA). Measured in meters.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

given_name.caption: Given Name
given_name.description: The given or first name of the user.

graph.caption: Graph
graph.description: A graph data structure representation with nodes and edges.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group object associated with an entity such as user, policy, or rule.

group_name.caption: Group Name
group_name.description: The name of the group that the resource belongs to.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The groups to which an entity belongs. See specific usage.

handshake_dur.caption: Handshake Duration
handshake_dur.description: The amount of total time for the TLS handshake to complete after the TCP connection is established, including client-side delays, in milliseconds.

has_mfa.caption: MFA Assigned
has_mfa.description: The user has a multi-factor or secondary-factor device assigned.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: The hash attribute is the value of a digital fingerprint including information about its algorithm.

hire_time.caption: Hire Time
hire_time.description: The timestamp when the user was or will be hired by the organization.

horizontal_accuracy.caption: Horizontal Accuracy
horizontal_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal position. This is based on ADS-B NACp. Measured in meters.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname of an endpoint or a device.

http_cookies.caption: HTTP Cookies
http_cookies.description: The cookies object describes details about HTTP cookies

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

http_method.caption: HTTP Method
http_method.description:
The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. Expected values:
  • TRACE
  • CONNECT
  • OPTIONS
  • HEAD
  • DELETE
  • POST
  • PUT
  • GET

http_only.caption: HTTP Only
http_only.description: A cookie attribute to make it inaccessible via JavaScript

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: The HTTP Request Object documents attributes of a request made to a web server.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: The HTTP Response from a web server to a requester.

http_status.caption: HTTP Status
http_status.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) status code returned to the client.

hypervisor.caption: Hypervisor
hypervisor.description: The name of the hypervisor running on the device. For example, Xen, VMware, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc.

iccid.caption: ICCID
iccid.description: The Integrated Circuit Card Identification of a mobile device. Typically it is a unique 18 to 22 digit number that identifies a SIM card.

identifier_cookie.caption: Identifier Cookie
identifier_cookie.description: The client identifier cookie during client/server exchange.

idle_timeout.caption: SSO Idle Timeout
idle_timeout.description: Duration (in minutes) of allowed inactivity before a timeout See specific usage.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.description: This object describes details about the Identity Provider used.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run a container or virtual machine.

ime.caption: IME
ime.description: The Input Method Editor (IME) file name.

imei.caption: IMEI
imei.description: The International Mobile Equipment Identity that is associated with the device.

imei_list.caption: IMEI List
imei_list.description: The International Mobile Equipment Identity values that are associated with the device.

impact.caption: Impact
impact.description: The impact , normalized to the caption of the impact_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

impact_id.caption: Impact ID
impact_id.description: The normalized impact of the incident or finding. Per NIST, this is the magnitude of harm that can be expected to result from the consequences of unauthorized disclosure, modification, destruction, or loss of information or information system availability.

1.caption: Low
1.description: The magnitude of harm is low.

2.caption: Medium
2.description: The magnitude of harm is moderate.

3.caption: High
3.description: The magnitude of harm is high.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: The magnitude of harm is high and the scope is widespread.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The impact is not mapped. See the impact attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

impact_score.caption: Impact Score
impact_score.description: The impact as an integer value of the finding, valid range 0-100.

intrusion_sets.caption: Intrusion Sets
intrusion_sets.description: A grouping of adversarial behaviors and resources believed to be associated with specific threat actors or campaigns. Intrusion sets often encompass multiple campaigns and are used to organize related activities under a common label.

injection_type.caption: Injection Type
injection_type.description: The process injection method, normalized to the caption of the injection_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

injection_type_id.caption: Injection Type ID
injection_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process injection method.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The injection type is not mapped. See the injection_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

install_state.caption: Install State
install_state.description: The install state, normalized to the caption of install_state_id. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

install_state_id.caption: Install State ID
install_state_id.description: The normalized state of the install.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The normalized install state is unknown.

1.caption: Installed
1.description: The item is installed.

2.caption: Not Installed
2.description: The item is not installed.

3.caption: Installed Pending Reboot
3.description: The item is installed pending reboot operation.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The install state is not mapped. See the install_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

integrity.caption: Integrity
integrity.description: The process integrity level, normalized to the caption of the integrity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source (Windows only).

integrity_id.caption: Integrity Level
integrity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process integrity level (Windows only).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The integrity level is not mapped. See the integrity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

internal_name.caption: Internal Name
internal_name.description: The name by which a resource identifies itself internally. See specific usage.

invoked_by.caption: Invoked by
invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal.

is_applied.caption: Applied
is_applied.description: A determination if a policy, rule, or enforcement action was applied.

is_backed_up.caption: Back Ups Configured
is_backed_up.description: Indicates whether the device or resource has a backup enabled, such as an automated snapshot or a cloud backup. For example, this is indicated by the cloudBackupEnabled value within JAMF Pro mobile devices or the registration of an AWS ARN with the AWS Backup service.

is_cleartext.caption: Cleartext Credentials
is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.

is_compliant.caption: Compliant Device
is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_deleted.caption: Deleted
is_deleted.description: Indicates if the entity was deleted. See specific usage.

is_directed.caption: Directed
is_directed.description: Indicates if the entity has directionality. See specific usage.

is_encrypted.caption: Encrypted
is_encrypted.description: Indicates if the entity was encrypted. See specific usage.

is_exploit_available.caption: Exploit Availability
is_exploit_available.description: Indicates if an exploit or a PoC (proof-of-concept) is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
is_fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_group_provisioning_enabled.caption: Group Provisioning Enabled
is_group_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether group provisioning is automated (e.g., for a SCIM resource). See specific usage.

is_hotp.caption: HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP)
is_hotp.description: Whether the authentication factor is an HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP).

is_http_only.caption: HTTP Only
is_http_only.description: This attribute prevents the cookie from being accessed via JavaScript.

is_managed.caption: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_mobile_account_active.caption: Mobile Account Active
is_mobile_account_active.description: Indicates whether the device has an active mobile account. For example, this is indicated by the itunesStoreAccountActive value within JAMF Pro mobile devices.

is_new_logon.caption: New Logon
is_new_logon.description: Indicates logon is from a device not seen before or a first time account logon.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

is_personal.caption: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

is_public.caption: Public
is_public.description: Determination of the public accessibility. See specific usage.

is_read.caption: Read
is_read.description: The indication of whether the email has been read.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_renewable.caption: Renewable
is_renewable.description: The indication of whether something is renewable. See specific usage.

is_renewal.caption: Renewal
is_renewal.description: The indication of whether the event or object represents a renewal. See specific usage.

is_secure.caption: Secure
is_secure.description: The cookie attribute indicates that cookies are sent to the server only when the request is encrypted using the HTTPS protocol.

is_self_signed.caption: Certificate Self-Signed
is_self_signed.description: Denotes whether a digital certificate is self-signed or signed by a known certificate authority (CA).

is_shared.caption: Shared Device
is_shared.description: The event occurred on a shared device.

is_superseded.caption: The patch is superseded.
is_superseded.description: The vendor patch has been replaced by another.

is_suspected_breach.caption: Suspected Breach
is_suspected_breach.description: A determination based on analytics as to whether a potential breach was found.

is_supervised.caption: Supervised Device
is_supervised.description: The event occurred on a supervised device. Devices that are supervised are typically mobile devices managed by a Mobile Device Management solution and are restricted from specific behaviors such as Apple AirDrop.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

is_totp.caption: Time-based One-time Password (TOTP)
is_totp.description: Whether the authentication factor is a Time-based One-time Password (TOTP).

is_truncated.caption: Is Truncated
is_truncated.description: Indicates that an attribute has been truncated. See specific usage.

is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

is_user_provisioning_enabled.caption: User Provisioning Enabled
is_user_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether user provisioning is automated (e.g., for a SCIM resource). See specific usage.

is_vpn.caption: VPN Session
is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.

isp.caption: ISP Name
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

isp_org.caption: ISP Org
isp_org.description: The organization name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP). This represents the parent organization or company that owns/operates the ISP. For example, Comcast Corporation would be the ISP org for Xfinity internet service. This attribute helps identify the ultimate provider when ISPs operate under different brand names.

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the issuer. See specific usage.

ja3_hash.caption: JA3 Hash
ja3_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3 string.

ja3s_hash.caption: JA3S Hash
ja3s_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3S string.

ja4_fingerprint_list.caption: JA4+ Fingerprints
ja4_fingerprint_list.description: A list of the JA4+ network fingerprints.

job.caption: Job
job.description: The job object that pertains to the event.

json_path.caption: JSON Path
json_path.description: The JSON path of the attribute. See specific usage.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kernel.caption: Kernel
kernel.description: The kernel resource object that pertains to the event.

kernel_release.caption: Kernel Release
kernel_release.description: The kernel release of the operating system. On Unix-based systems, this is determined from the uname -r command output, for example "5.15.0-122-generic".

key_length.caption: Key Length
key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.

key_uid.caption: Key UID
key_uid.description: The unique identifier of the key. See specific usage.

keyboard_layout.caption: Keyboard Layout
keyboard_layout.description: The keyboard locale identifier name (e.g., en-US).

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels attached to an entity. See specific usage.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

last_login_time.caption: Last Login
last_login_time.description: The last time when the user logged in.

last_run_time.caption: Last Run
last_run_time.description: The last run time of application or service. See specific usage.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The most recent detection time of the activity or object. See specific usage.

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

latency.caption: Latency
latency.description: The HTTP response latency measured in milliseconds.

ldap_cn.caption: LDAP Common Name
ldap_cn.description: The LDAP and X.500 commonName attribute, typically the full name of the person. For example, John Doe.

ldap_dn.caption: LDAP Distinguished Name
ldap_dn.description: The X.500 Distinguished Name (DN) is a structured string that uniquely identifies an entry, such as a user, in an X.500 directory service For example, cn=John Doe,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

lease_dur.caption: Lease Duration
lease_dur.description: This represents the length of the DHCP lease in seconds. This is present in DHCP Ack events.

leave_time.caption: Leave Time
leave_time.description: The timestamp when the user left or will be leaving the organization.

length.caption: Response Length
length.description: The HTTP response length, in number of bytes.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The name or identifier of the license applied on package or software. See SPDX License List.

license_url.caption: Software License URL
license_url.description: The URL pointing to the license applied on package or software. This is typically a LICENSE.md file within a repository.

lineage.caption: Lineage
lineage.description: The lineage of the process, represented by a list of paths for each ancestor process. For example: ['/usr/sbin/sshd', '/usr/bin/bash', '/usr/bin/whoami'].

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: The Load Balancer object contains information related to the device that is distributing incoming traffic to specified destinations.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the load type. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The load type is not mapped. See the load_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

locations.caption: Geo Locations
locations.description: A list of detailed geographical locations.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_type.caption: Log Type
log_type.description: The log type, normalized to the caption of the log_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: OS
1.description: The log type is an Operating System log.

2.caption: Application
2.description: The log type is an Application log.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The log type is not mapped. See the log_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

loggers.caption: Loggers
loggers.description: An array of Logger objects that describe the devices and logging products between the event source and its eventual destination. Note, this attribute can be used when there is a complex end-to-end path of event flow.

login_endpoint.caption: Login Endpoint
login_endpoint.description: URL for initiating a login request. See specific usage.

logon_process.caption: Logon Process
logon_process.description: The trusted process that validated the authentication credentials.

logon_type.caption: Logon Type
logon_type.description: The logon type, normalized to the caption of the logon_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: System
1.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.

2.caption: Interactive
2.description: A local logon to device console.

3.caption: Network
3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.

4.caption: Batch
4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.

5.caption: OS Service
5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.

7.caption: Unlock
7.description: A user unlocked the device.

8.caption: Network Cleartext
8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.

9.caption: New Credentials
9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.

10.caption: Remote Interactive
10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.

11.caption: Cached Interactive
11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.

12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive
12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The logon type is not mapped. See the logon_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

logout_endpoint.caption: Logout Endpoint
logout_endpoint.description: URL for initiating a logout request. See specific usage.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address that is associated with the network interface.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.description: Describes details about the scan job that identified malware on the target system.

num_volumes.caption: Number of Volumes
num_volumes.description: The number of volumes in the storage device. See specific usage.

num_infected.caption: Number of Infected Entities
num_infected.description: The number of infected entities. See specific usage.

unique_malware_count.caption: Unique Malware Count
unique_malware_count.description: The number of unique malware detected during a scan. See specific usage.

manager.caption: Manager
manager.description: The user's manager. This helps in understanding an org hierarchy. This should only ever be populated once in an event. I.e. there should not be a manager's manager in an event.

match_details.caption: Match Details
match_details.description: The data in a request that rule matched. For example: '["10","and","1"]'.

match_location.caption: Match Location
match_location.description: The location of the matched data in the source which resulted in the triggered firewall rule. For example: HEADER.

meid.caption: MEID
meid.description: The Mobile Equipment Identifier. It's a unique number that identifies a Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA) mobile device.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

message_trace_uid.caption: Message Trace UID
message_trace_uid.description: The identifier that tracks a message that travels through multiple points of a messaging service.

references.description: For example Office 365 Message Trace Report.

message_uid.caption: Message UID
message_uid.description: The email header Message-ID value, as defined by RFC 5322.

meets_criteria.caption: Meets Criteria
meets_criteria.description: Determines if an assessment, control, policy, or otherwise meets its assessment criteria. See specific usage.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

metadata_endpoint.caption: Metadata Endpoint
metadata_endpoint.description: URL where metadata about a configuration or resource is available (e.g., for SAML configurations). See specific usage.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The general purpose metrics associated with the event. See specific usage.

mime_type.caption: MIME type
mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.

mitigation.caption: MITRE Mitigation
mitigation.description: The Mitigation object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Mitigation ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model name of an entity. See specific usage.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the object associated with the event. See specific usage.

module.caption: Module
module.description: The module that pertains to the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.

name_servers.caption: Name Servers
name_servers.description: A collection of name servers related to a domain registration or other record.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: The Network Endpoint object describes characteristics of a network endpoint. See specific usage.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The physical or virtual network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

next_run_time.caption: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The next run time. See specific usage.

nist.caption: NIST List
nist.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework recommendations for managing the cybersecurity risk.

nodes.caption: Nodes
nodes.description: The list of node objects that are part of the graph.

num_network_items.caption: Scanned Network Items
num_network_items.description: The number of network items scanned.

num_registry_items.caption: Scanned Registry Items
num_registry_items.description: The number of registry items scanned.

num_resolutions.caption: Resolutions
num_resolutions.description: The number of items that were resolved.

num_violations.caption: Violations
num_violations.description: The number of times the policy or rule was violated.

number.caption: Number
number.description: The number of the entity. See specific usage.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

occurrence_details.caption: Occurrence Details
occurrence_details.description: Details about where in the target entity the specified information was discovered. See specific usage.

occurrences.caption: Occurrences
occurrences.description: A list of occurrence_details objects, each describing where in the target entity the specified information was discovered. See specific usage.

office_location.caption: Office Location
office_location.description: The primary office location associated with the user. This could be any string and isn't a specific address. For example, South East Virtual.

opcode.caption: DNS Opcode
opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.

opcode_id.caption: DNS Opcode ID
opcode_id.description: The DNS opcode ID specifies the normalized query message type as defined in RFC-5395.

1.caption: Inverse Query
1.description: Inverse query, obsolete

2.caption: Status
2.description: Server status request

3.caption: Reserved
3.description: Reserved, not used

4.caption: Notify
4.description: Zone change notification

5.caption: Update
5.description: Dynamic DNS update

6.caption: DSO Message
6.description: DNS Stateful Operations (DSO)

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNS Opcode is not defined by the RFC. See the opcode attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

open_mask.caption: Open Mask
open_mask.description: The Windows options needed to open a registry key.

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

original_time.caption: Original Time
original_time.description: The original event time as reported by the event source. For example, the time in the original format from system event log such as Syslog on Unix/Linux and the System event file on Windows. Omit if event is generated instead of collected via logs.

os_machine_uuid.caption: OS Machine UUID
os_machine_uuid.description: The operating system assigned Machine ID. In Windows, this is the value stored at the registry path: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\MachineGuid. In Linux, this is stored in the file: /etc/machine-id.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of the organizational unit, within an organization.  For example, Finance, IT, R&D

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The overall score as reported by the event source. See specific usage.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file/object.

package.caption: Software Package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package.

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

package_manager_url.caption: Package Manager URL
package_manager_url.description: The URL of the package or library at the package manager, or the specific URL or URI of an internal package manager link such as AWS CodeArtifact or Artifactory.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The packet identifier assigned by the protocol.

packets.caption: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.caption: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.

packets_out.caption: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

page_number.caption: Page Number
page_number.description: The page number of the document. See specific usage.

parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

parent_process.caption: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of this process object. It is recommended to only populate this field for the top-level process object, to prevent deep nesting. Additional ancestry information can be supplied in the ancestry attribute.

parent_uid.caption: Parent Unique ID
parent_uid.description: The unique identifier of an object's parent object. See specific usage.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

pattern_match.caption: Pattern Match
pattern_match.description: A text, binary, file name, or datastore that matched against a detection rule.

percentile.caption: EPSS Percentile
percentile.description: The EPSS score's percentile representing relative importance and ranking of the score in the larger EPSS dataset.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event.

permission.caption: Permission
permission.description: The IAM permission related to an event

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victim’s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victim’s system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victim’s system.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the mission’s goal.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The kill chain phase is not mapped. See the phase attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

phone_number.caption: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The number associated with the phone.

phones.caption: Phones
phones.description: The phone numbers associated with the user

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Describes details of a policy. See specific usage.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The TCP/UDP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

precision.caption: Precision
precision.description: The numeric precision. See specific usage.

pressure_altitude.caption: Pressure Altitude
pressure_altitude.description: The uncorrected barometric pressure altitude (based on reference standard 29.92 inHg, 1013.25 mb) provides a reference for algorithms that utilize 'altitude deltas' between aircraft. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m.. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

prev_security_level.caption: Previous Security Level
prev_security_level.description: The previous security level of the entity

prev_security_level_id.caption: Previous Security Level ID
prev_security_level_id.description: The previous security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the prev_security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

prev_security_states.caption: Previous Security States
prev_security_states.description: The previous security states. See specific usage.

priority.caption: Priority
priority.description: The priority, normalized to the caption of the priority_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

priority_id.caption: Priority ID
priority_id.description: The normalized priority. Priority identifies the relative importance of the incident or finding. It is a measurement of urgency.

1.caption: Low
1.description: Application or personal procedure is unusable, where a workaround is available or a repair is possible.

2.caption: Medium
2.description: Non-critical function or procedure is unusable or hard to use causing operational disruptions with no direct impact on a service's availability. A workaround is available.

3.caption: High
3.description: Critical functionality or network access is interrupted, degraded or unusable, having a severe impact on services availability. No acceptable alternative is possible.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: Interruption making a critical functionality inaccessible or a complete network interruption causing a severe impact on services availability. There is no possible alternative.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The priority is not normalized.

processed_time.caption: Processed Time
processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

profiles.caption: Profiles
profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event. Profiles should be referenced by their name attribute for core profiles, or extension/name for profiles from extensions.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The protocol name. See specific usage.

protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

protocol_ver.caption: Protocol Version
protocol_ver.description: The Protocol version, normalized to the caption of the protocol_ver_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

protocol_ver_id.caption: Protocol Version ID
protocol_ver_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Protocol version. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The protocol version is not mapped. See the protocol_ver attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The origin of information associated with the event. See specific usage.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

query_evidence.caption: Query Evidence
query_evidence.description: The resulting evidence discovered from the evidence search request.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a database query must be written using a specific syntax.

query_language.caption: Query Language
query_language.description: The query language, normalized to the caption of the query_language_id value. See specific usage.

query_language_id.caption: Query Language ID
query_language_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query language. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The Query Language is not mapped. See the query_language attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

query_result_id.caption: Query Result ID
query_result_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query result.

1.caption: Exists
1.description: The target was found.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The target was partially found.

3.caption: Does not exist
3.description: The target was not found.

4.caption: Error
4.description: The discovery attempt failed.

5.caption: Unsupported
5.description: Discovery of the target was not supported.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query result is not mapped. See the query_result attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

query_type.caption: Query Type
query_type.description: The normalized caption of query_type_id or the source-specific query type.

query_type_id.caption: Query Type ID
query_type_id.description: The normalized type of system query performed against a device or system component.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The query type was unknown or not specified.

1.caption: Kernel
1.description: A query about kernel resources including system calls, shared mutex, or other kernel components.

2.caption: File
2.description: A query about file attributes, metadata, content, hash values, or properties.

3.caption: Folder
3.description: A query about folder attributes, metadata, content, or structure.

4.caption: Admin Group
4.description: A query about group membership, privileges, domain, or group properties.

5.caption: Job
5.description: A query about scheduled jobs, their command lines, run states, or execution times.

6.caption: Module
6.description: A query about loaded modules, their base addresses, load types, or function entry points.

7.caption: Network Connection
7.description: A query about active network connections, boundaries, protocols, or TCP states.

8.caption: Network Interfaces
8.description: A query about physical or virtual network interfaces, their IP/MAC addresses, or types.

9.caption: Peripheral Device
9.description: A query about attached peripheral devices, their classes, models, or vendor information.

10.caption: Process
10.description: A query about running processes, command lines, ancestry, loaded modules, or execution context.

11.caption: Service
11.description: A query about system services, their names, versions, labels, or properties.

12.caption: Session
12.description: A query about authenticated user or service sessions, their creation times, or issuer details.

13.caption: User
13.description: A query about user accounts, their properties, credentials, or domain information.

14.caption: Users
14.description: A query about multiple users belonging to an administrative group.

15.caption: Startup Item
15.description: A query about startup configuration items, their run modes, start types, or current states.

16.caption: Registry Key
16.description: A Windows-specific query about registry keys, their paths, security descriptors, or modification times.

17.caption: Registry Value
17.description: A Windows-specific query about registry values, their data types, content, or names.

18.caption: Prefetch
18.description: A Windows-specific query about prefetch files, their run counts, last execution times, or existence.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query type was not mapped to a standard category. See the query_type attribute for source-specific value.

radius.caption: Radius
radius.description: Farthest horizontal distance from the reported location at which any UA in a group may be located (meters). Also allows defining the area where an Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. Default: 0 m.

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: The rate limit for a rate-based rule.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size
raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.

rcode.caption: Response Code
rcode.description: The server response code, normalized to the caption of the rcode_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID
rcode_id.description: The normalized identifier of the server response code. See specific usage.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The DNS response code is unknown.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNS response code is not defined by the RFC. See the rcode attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

record_index_in_array.caption: Record Index in Array
record_index_in_array.description: The index of the record in the array of records.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs supporting the finding/detection.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name or the code of a region. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Describes analytics related to the analytic of a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

related_component.caption: Related Component
related_component.description: The package URL (PURL) of the component that this software component has a relationship with.

related_cves.caption: Related CVEs
related_cves.description: Describes Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) entries that are related to an entity. See specific usage.

related_cwes.caption: Related CWEs
related_cwes.description: Describes Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) entries that are related to an entity. See specific usage.

related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.

related_events_count.caption: Related Events/Findings Count
related_events_count.description: Number of related events or findings.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerability IDs
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerability IDs (e.g. CVE ID) that are related to this vulnerability.

relation.caption: Relation
relation.description: The relationship between two entities. See specific usage.

relationship.caption: Relationship
relationship.description: The relationship between two software components, normalized to the caption of the relationship_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

relationship_id.caption: Relationship ID
relationship_id.description: The normalized identifier of the relationship between two software components.

1.caption: Depends On
1.description: The component is a dependency of another component. Can be used to define both direct and transitive dependencies.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The relationship is not mapped. See the relationship attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

relay.caption: Relay
relay.description: The network relay that is associated with the event.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

remote_display.caption: Remote Display
remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The machine-readable email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

reply_to_mailboxes.caption: Reply To Mailboxes
reply_to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header Reply To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: General Purpose API Request Object. See specific usage

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask. See specific usage.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

resource_relationship.caption: Resource Relationship
resource_relationship.description: Describes entities related to the resource, using a graph structure. See specific usage.

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

resources.caption: Resources Array
resources.description: Describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.

response_time.caption: Response Time
response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
