99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

row_number.caption: Row Number
row_number.description: The row number. See specific usage.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

rssi.caption: RSSI
rssi.description: Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) is a measurement of the power of a radio signal. See specific usage.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.description: The rules that reported the events.

run_mode_ids.caption: Run Mode IDs
run_mode_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers that describe application attributes when it is running. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run mode is not mapped. See the run_modes attribute, which contains data source specific values.

run_modes.caption: Run Modes
run_modes.description: The list of run_modes, normalized to the captions of the run_mode_ids values.  In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The state of the job or service, normalized to the caption of the run_state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the state of the job or service. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run state is not mapped. See the run_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

sbom.caption: Software Bill Of Materials
sbom.description: The Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) object describes the characteristics of a generated SBOM for a software package.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

scan.caption: Scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a scan.  See specific usage.

schedule_uid.caption: Schedule UID
schedule_uid.description: The unique identifier of the schedule associated with a scan job.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

scim.caption: SCIM
scim.description: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) resource object provides a structured set of attributes related to SCIM protocols used for identity provisioning and management across cloud-based platforms. It standardizes user and group provisioning details, enabling identity synchronization and lifecycle management with compatible Identity Providers (IdPs) and applications. SCIM is defined in RFC-7634

references.description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) RFC.

scim_group_schema.caption: SCIM Group Schema
scim_group_schema.description: SCIM provides a schema for representing groups, identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:Group as defined in RFC-7634. This attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource.

references.description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) RFC spec.

scim_user_schema.caption: SCIM User Schema
scim_user_schema.description: SCIM provides a resource type for user resources. The core schema for user is identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User as defined in RFC-7634. his attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource. This object is inclusive of both the basic and Enterprise User Schema Extension.

references.description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) RFC spec.

scopes.caption: Scopes
scopes.description: Scopes define the specific permissions or actions that the client is allowed to perform on behalf of the user. Each scope represents a different set of permissions, and the user can selectively grant or deny access to specific scopes during the authorization process.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

8.caption: Possibly Malicious
8.description: Strong possibility of maliciousness.

9.caption: Probably Malicious
9.description: Indicators of maliciousness.

10.caption: Malicious
10.description: Proven evidence of maliciousness.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

script_content.caption: Script Content
script_content.description: The script content, normalized to UTF-8 encoding irrespective of its original encoding. When emitting this attribute, it may be appropriate to truncate large scripts. When consuming this attribute, large scripts should be anticipated.

section_a.caption: JA4 Section A
section_a.description: The 'a' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_b.caption: JA4 Section B
section_b.description: The 'b' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_c.caption: JA4 Section C
section_c.description: The 'c' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_d.caption: JA4 Section D
section_d.description: The 'd' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

security_level.caption: Security Level
security_level.description: The current security level of the entity

security_level_id.caption: Security Level ID
security_level_id.description: The current security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

security_states.caption: Security States
security_states.description: The current security states. See specific usage.

sensitivity.caption: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the event.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

share.caption: Share
share.description: The share name. See specific usage.

share_type.caption: Share Type
share_type.description: The share type, normalized to the caption of the share_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

share_type_id.caption: Share Type ID
share_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the share type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The share type is not mapped. See the share_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

short_desc.caption: Short Description
short_desc.description: The short description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_hello.caption: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

software_components.caption: Software Components
software_components.description: The list of software components used in the software package.

source.caption: Source
source.description: The source of the event or object. See specific usage.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

span.caption: Span
span.description: The information about the span. See specific usage.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing towards the source of an entity. See specific usage.

sso.caption: SSO
sso.description: The Single Sign-On (SSO) object provides a structure for normalizing SSO attributes, configuration, and/or settings from Identity Providers.

standards.caption: Compliance Standards: List
standards.description: Compliance standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

start_column.caption: Start Column
start_column.description: The start column number. See specific usage.

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of code block identified as vulnerable.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

start_type.caption: Start Type
start_type.description: The start type of a service, driver, or application.

start_type_id.caption: Start Type ID
start_type_id.description: The start type ID of a service or application.

1.caption: Auto
1.description: Service started automatically during system startup.

2.caption: Boot
2.description: Device driver started by the system loader.

3.caption: On Demand
3.description: Started on demand. For example, by the Windows Service Control Manager when a process calls the StartService function.

4.caption: Disabled
4.description: The service is disabled, and cannot be started.

5.caption: All Logins
5.description: Started on all user logins.

6.caption: Specific User Login
6.description: Started on specific user logins.

7.caption: Scheduled
7.description: Stared according to a schedule.

8.caption: System Changed
8.description: Started when a system item, such as a file or registry key, changes.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The start type is not mapped. See the start_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

startup_item.caption: Startup Item
startup_item.description: The startup item object describes an application component that has associated startup criteria and configurations.

state.caption: State
state.description: The state of the event or object, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: A list of descriptions, containing additional information about the event/finding status.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

storage_class.caption: Storage Class
storage_class.description: The storage class of the entity. See specific usage.

stratum.caption: Stratum
stratum.description: The stratum level of the NTP server's time source, normalized to the caption of the stratum_id value.

stratum_id.caption: Stratum ID
stratum_id.description: The normalized identifier of the stratum level, as defined in RFC-5905.

1.caption: Primary Server
1.description: The highest precision primary server (e.g atomic clock or GPS).

2.caption: Secondary Server
2.description: A secondary level server (possible values: 2-15).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The stratum level is not mapped. See the stratum attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

sub_technique.caption: MITRE Sub-technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub-technique object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Sub-technique ID and/or name associated to an attack.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

subdomains.caption: Subdomains
subdomains.description: An array of subdomain strings. Can be used to collect several subdomains such as those from Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs).

subject.caption: Subject Details
subject.description: The identifier of the subject. See specific usage.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

surname.caption: Surname
surname.description: The last or family name for the user.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

table.caption: Table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.

tactic.caption: MITRE Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix.

@deprecated.message: Use the labels or tags attribute instead.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs attached to an entity. A Tag may be used to categorize, filter, and search for entities. For e.g. "Environment": "Production", "Owner": "007". See specific usage.

target.caption: Target
target.description: The target of the event or object. See specific usage.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

tcp_state_id.caption: TCP State ID
tcp_state_id.description: The state of the TCP socket for the network connection.

1.caption: ESTABLISHED
1.description: The socket has an established connection between a local application and a remote peer.

2.caption: SYN-SENT
2.description: The socket is actively trying to establish a connection to a remote peer.

3.caption: SYN-RECEIVED
3.description: The socket has passively received a connection request from a remote peer.

4.caption: FIN-WAIT-1
4.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.

5.caption: FIN-WAIT-2
5.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.

6.caption: TIME-WAIT
6.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting to be sure that the remote peer received the last acknowledgement.

7.caption: CLOSED
7.description: The socket is not in use.

8.caption: CLOSE-WAIT
8.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, and the system is waiting for the local application to close its half of the connection.

9.caption: LAST-ACK
9.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, the local application has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting for the remote peer to acknowledge the close.

10.caption: LISTEN
10.description: The socket is listening for incoming connections.

11.caption: CLOSING
11.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application and the remote peer simultaneously, and the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close attempt of the local application.

technique.caption: MITRE Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Technique ID and/or name associated to an attack.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal. Ex: the tty or pts value.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

ticket.caption: Ticket
ticket.description: The linked ticket in the ticketing system.

tickets.caption: Tickets
tickets.description: The associated ticket(s) in the ticketing system. Each ticket contains details like ticket ID, status, etc.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.

tlp.caption: Traffic Light Protocol
tlp.description: The Traffic Light Protocol was created to facilitate greater sharing of potentially sensitive information and more effective collaboration. TLP provides a simple and intuitive schema for indicating with whom potentially sensitive information can be shared.

to.caption: To
to.description: The machine-readable email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

to_mailboxes.caption: To Mailboxes
to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.

trace.caption: Trace
trace.description: The information about the trace. See specific usage.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

traffic.caption: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

transaction_uid.caption: Transaction UID
transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

transformation_info_list.caption: Transformation Info
transformation_info_list.description: An array of transformation info that describes the mappings or transforms applied to the data.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage.

tree_uid.caption: Tree UID
tree_uid.description: The tree id is a unique SMB identifier which represents an open connection to a share.

threat_actor.caption: Threat Actor
threat_actor.description: A threat actor is an individual or group that conducts malicious cyber activities, often with financial, political, or ideological motives.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

tunnel_interface.caption: Interface
tunnel_interface.description: The information about the tunnel interface. See specific usage.

tunnel_type.caption: Type
tunnel_type.description: The tunnel type. See specific usage.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

udid.caption: Unique Device Identifier
udid.description: The Apple assigned Unique Device Identifier (UDID). For iOS, iPadOS, tvOS, watchOS and visionOS devices, this is the UDID. For macOS devices, it is the Provisioning UDID. For example: 00008020-008D4548007B4F26

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier. See specific usage.

unmanned_aerial_system.caption: Unmanned Aerial System
unmanned_aerial_system.description: The Unmanned Aerial System object describes the characteristics, Position Location Information (PLI), and other metadata of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and other unmanned and drone systems used in Remote ID. Remote ID is defined in the Standard Specification for Remote ID and Tracking (ASTM Designation: F3411-22a) ASTM F3411-22a.

unmanned_system_operating_area.caption: UAS Operating Area
unmanned_system_operating_area.description: The UAS Operating Area object describes details about a precise area of operations for a UAS flight or mission.

unmanned_system_operator.caption: Unmanned Systems Operator
unmanned_system_operator.description: The human or machine operator of an Unmanned System.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

untruncated_size.caption: Untruncated Size
untruncated_size.description: The size in bytes of an attribute before truncation. See specific usage.

uri.caption: URI
uri.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is a string of characters that identifies a resource on the Internet. URIs can identify physical resources, like webpages and documents. See specific usage.

uploaded_time.caption: Uploaded Time
uploaded_time.description: The timestamp at which an entity was uploaded. See specific usage.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

urls.caption: URLs
urls.description: The URLs that pertain to the event or object.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

user_result.caption: User Result
user_result.description: The result of the user account change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

users.caption: Users
users.description: The users that pertain to the event or object.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value associated to an attribute. See specific usage.

values.caption: Values
values.description: An array of values associated to an attribute. See specific usage.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

vendor_attributes.caption: Vendor Attributes
vendor_attributes.description:
The Vendor Attributes object can be used to represent values of attributes populated by the Vendor/Finding Provider. It can help distinguish between the vendor-prodvided values and consumer-updated values, of key attributes like severity_id.
The original finding producer should not populate this object. It should be populated by consuming systems that support data mutability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor. See specific usage.

verdict.caption: Verdict
verdict.description: The verdict assigned to an Incident finding.

verdict_id.caption: Verdict ID
verdict_id.description: The normalized verdict of an Incident.

1.caption: False Positive
1.description: The incident is a false positive.

2.caption: True Positive
2.description: The incident is a true positive.

3.caption: Disregard
3.description: The incident can be disregarded as it is unimportant, an error or accident.

4.caption: Suspicious
4.description: The incident is suspicious.

5.caption: Benign
5.description: The incident is benign.

6.caption: Test
6.description: The incident is a test.

7.caption: Insufficient Data
7.description: The incident has insufficient data to make a verdict.

8.caption: Security Risk
8.description: The incident is a security risk.

9.caption: Managed Externally
9.description: The incident remediation or required actions are managed externally.

10.caption: Duplicate
10.description: The incident is a duplicate.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

volume.caption: Volume
volume.description: The volume on the storage device where the file is located. See specific usage.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

vulnerabilities.caption: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: This object describes vulnerabilities reported in a security finding.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability

web_resources.caption: Web Resources
web_resources.description: Describes details about web resources that were affected by an activity/event.

web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result
web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.description: The resources of a WHOIS record for a given domain. This can include domain names, IP address blocks, autonomous system information, and/or contact and registration information for a domain.

working_directory.caption: Working Directory
working_directory.description: The working directory of a process.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

traits.caption: Traits
traits.description: The traits that describe characteristics, features of an entity. See specific usage.

types.caption: Data Types
types.description: The data types available in OCSF. Each data type specifies constraints in the form regular expressions, max lengths or value limits. Implementors of OCSF should ensure they abide to these constraints.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description:
The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example:
2024-09-10T23:20:50.520Z,
2024-09-10 23:20:50.520789Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description:
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example:
MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

file_path_t.caption: File Path
file_path_t.description:
The full path to the file. For example: For example:
c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description:
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. It may be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). For example:
r2-d2.example.com.,
mx.example.com

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description:
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example:
192.168.200.24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet. For example:
192.168.1.0/24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description:
The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example:
1618524549901.
